DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: SILVA, L. M.;DA SILVA, LILIAN MIEKO;SILVA, LILIAN MIEKO DA

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduao em Engenharia de Materiais (2011) e mestrado em Engenharia e Tecnologia Espaciais, na rea de concentrao de Cincia e Tecnologia de Materiais e Sensores (2014). Atualmente bolsista de doutorado no Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais. Trabalha na rea de materiais carbonosos e eletroqumica, desenvolvendo materiais compsitos de fibra de carbono/nanodiamante/polianilina para processos de limpeza de gua e converso de energia.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: bachelor's at Engenharia de Materiais from Universidade do Vale do Paraba (2011) and master's at Aerospace Engineering from Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais (2014). , acting on the following subjects: silcio poroso, cvd, nanodiamante dopado com boro, ataque eletroqumico and anodizao.

GRADUACAO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-DE-CONCLUSAO-DE-CURSO: Reprocessamento e Caracterizao de Compsitos Termoplsticos PPS/Fibra de Carbono

CURSO-TECNICO-PROFISSIONALIZANTE.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Escola Politcnica de Ensino Mdio Comendador Manoel Pedro de Oliveira

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Atribuies: Anlises fsico-qumicas em petrleo e seus derivados, em gua, e em despejos industriais. Anlises de cromatografia lquida e gasosa. Preparo de solues.

ATUACAO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Departamento de Cincia e Tecnologia Aeroespacial

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Ttulo do projeto: Avaliao da resistncia corroso e oxidao da liga Ti-6Al-4V aps tratamentos trmicos e superficiais. Atribuies: Estudo de corroso por Salt Spray (nvoa salina) em ligas de Titnio-Alumnio-Vandio, tratadas termicamente e superficialmente. Caracterizao de ligas metlicas. Processamento e caracterizao de composies cermicas para aplicao aeronutica.

Atribuies: Desenvolvimento e implantao de metodologia para anlises de metais por ICP-OES, em gua e efluentes. Anlises fsico-qumicas. Controle de Qualidade: Reviso de instrues de trabalho e documentos, implantao de controles de qualidade internos, desenvolvimento de novas metodologias, anlise crtica, ao corretiva, ao preventiva, relatrio de melhoria da qualidade, resoluo de no-conformidades. Participao na acreditao de 22 novos parmetros pelo INMETRO, em anlises de metais por ICP-OES, de acordo com a Norma ISO IEC 17025, para laboratrios acreditados.

ATUACAO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Alltec - Ind. de Componentes em Materiais Compostos

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Atribuies: Reprocessamento de refugos de materiais compsitos termoplsticos PPS/Fibra de Carbono, via moldagem por compresso a quente. Caracterizao do material reprocessado para avaliao da morfologia e das propriedades trmicas e mecnicas, para possvel reaproveitamento.
Atribuies: Produo de silcio poroso, por ataque eletroqumico, utilizando soluo de HF-acetonitrila como eletrlito. Crescimento de nanodiamante dopado com boro, sobre substrato de silcio poroso.
Desenvolvimento de compsitos de fibra de carbono/nanodiamante/polianilina visando aplicao em processos de limpeza de gua e converso de energia.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Investigation of Boron Doped Nanocrystalline Diamond Films Grown on Porous Silicon Substrate under Different Doping Concentrations
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Investigation of Boron Doped Nanocrystalline Diamond Films Grown on Porous Silicon Substrate under Different Doping Concentrations

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The production and characterization of porous silicon (PS) samples were studied as well as their use as substrates to grow boron doped nanocrystalline diamond (NCD) films. PS represents a suitable material for diamond growth due to its large number of nucleation sites and surface area, becoming an excellent material for porous electrodes. NCD films were grown by chemical vapor deposition (CVD) technique by balancing H2/CH4/Ar gas mixture, at two different boron levels. Doping was conducted by an additional hydrogen line passing through a bubbler containing B2O3 dissolved in methanol. Two ratios of boron/carbon were used of 2000 and 20000 ppm in the bubbler solution. Scanning electron microscopy, Raman spectroscopy and X-ray diffraction were used to characterize the films as well as the PS substrate. Results showed that it is possible to obtain NCD films on PS substrate with good quality at different doping levels.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Growth time influence to produce boron doped nanocrystalline diamond films on porous silicon substrate

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.INSTITUICAO-PROMOTORA: Sociedade Brasileira de Pesquisa em Materiais - Brazil MRS

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: SILVA, L. M.;DA SILVA, LILIAN MIEKO;SILVA, LILIAN MIEKO DA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Porous silicon (PS) can be used as a substrate for nanocrystalline diamond (NCD) films growth, due to its large number of nucleation sites. By the doping with boron, it is possible to obtain diamond with lower resistivity which provides a promising material for electrochemical applications [1,2]. PS is formed by electrochemical etching of a crystalline silicon wafer in HF solutions under a controlled current [3]. The difficulty of growing diamond films on porous silicon is the fact that the film should fill the pores without covering them. Therefore, this work consists in evaluating the best growth time for obtaining diamond films. PS samples were prepared from n-type monocrystalline silicon wafers (100) with 1-20 ohm.cm of resistivity, by anodization technique, using HF-acetonitrile solution as electrolyte. The electrodes were polarized under 56,5 mA/cm, during 120 minutes. The boron doped NCD films were grown by Chemical Vapor Deposition technique using CH4, H2 and Ar, in different growth times. The doping process consisted of an additional hydrogen line, passing through a bubbler containing B2O3 dissolved in methanol, with ratio boron/carbon of 20000 ppm in solution. Scanning electron microscopy (SEM) and Raman spectroscopy were used to evaluate the quality of the films and to define the best growth time. SEM images confirmed that the NCD films covered the bottom and the top surfaces of the pores, as well as its walls, as a continuous diamond layer, without filling them, which kept the suitable sample porosity.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Effect of current density in optical and morphological characteristics of porous silicon

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.INSTITUICAO-PROMOTORA: Sociedade Brasileira de Pesquisa em Materiais - Brazil MRS

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: SILVA, L. M.;DA SILVA, LILIAN MIEKO;SILVA, LILIAN MIEKO DA

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Influncia da Concentrao de Metano no Crescimento de Filmes de Diamante Ultrananocristalino Dopados com Boro sobre Substrato de Silcio Poroso

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XXXIV Congresso Brasileiro de Aplicaes de Vcuo na Indstria e na Cincia

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: SILVA, L. M.;DA SILVA, LILIAN MIEKO;SILVA, LILIAN MIEKO DA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Filmes de diamante ultrananocristalino (UNCD) so obtidos a partir de elevada taxa de renucleao e se caracterizam por apresentar crescimento no colunar [1]. Estes filmes possuem uma excelente combinao de propriedades, possibilitando sua aplicao em diversas reas tecnolgicas [2]. A dopagem com boro permite obter diamante com menor resistividade, ideal para aplicaes eletroqumicas. O silcio poroso (PS) tem sido utilizado para crescimento de diamante por apresentar grande nmero de stios de nucleao e grande rea superficial, sendo excelente para obteno de eletrodos porosos [3,4]. Neste trabalho, foram produzidas amostras de PS por ataque eletroqumico, a partir de silcio monocristalino tipo-n. Utilizou-se soluo de HF-acetonitrila como eletrlito, e densidade de corrente de 56,5 mA/cm2 durante 120 minutos. As amostras de PS foram usadas como substrato para crescimento dos filmes de UNCD atravs do processo HFCVD (Hot Filament Chemical Vapor Deposition), utilizando mistura de CH4, H2 e Ar, durante 4 horas. Variou-se a concentrao de metano, para avaliar sua influncia na morfologia e qualidade dos filmes, que foram caracterizados por MEV e espectroscopia de espalhamento Raman. Verificou-se que elevadas concentraes de CH4 provocam grafitizao do filme, enquanto concentraes adequadas promovem a obteno de filmes uniformes de UNCD que preenchem os poros continuamente.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Investigation of boron doped nanocrystalline diamond films grown on porous silicon substrate under different doping concentrations

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: PTECH 2013 Ninth International Latin American Conference on Powder Technology

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: SILVA, L. M.;DA SILVA, LILIAN MIEKO;SILVA, LILIAN MIEKO DA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The production and characterization of porous silicon (PS) samples were studied as well as their use as substrates to grow boron doped nanocrystalline diamond (NCD) films. PS represents a suitable material for diamond growth due to its large number of nucleation sites and surface area, becoming an excellent material for porous electrodes. NCD films were grown by chemical vapor deposition (CVD) technique by balancing H2/CH4/Ar gas mixture, at two different boron levels. Doping was conducted by an additional hydrogen line passing through a bubbler containing B2O3 dissolved in methanol. Two ratios of boron/carbon were used of 2000 and 20000 ppm in the bubbler solution. Scanning electron microscopy, Raman spectroscopy and X-ray diffraction were used to characterize the films as well as the PS substrate. The results showed that it is possible to obtain NCD films on PS substrate with good quality and different doping levels.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Electrochemical characterization of boron doped nanocrystalline diamond films grown on porous silicon
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO-INGLES: Electrochemical characterization of boron doped nanocrystalline diamond films grown on porous silicon

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 1 Congresso Ibero-Americano de Superfcie, Materiais e Aplicaes de Vcuo - 35 Congresso Brasileiro de Aplicaes de Vcuo na Indstria e na Cincia

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: SILVA, L. M.;DA SILVA, LILIAN MIEKO;SILVA, LILIAN MIEKO DA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Boron doped ultrananocrystalline diamond (BDUND) films were grown and characterized on porous silicon (PS) substrates. PS samples were prepared from n-type monocrystalline silicon wafers (100) with 1-20 Ω.cm of resistivity, by electrochemical etching, using HF-acetonitrile solution as electrolyte. BDUND films were grown by Hot Filament Chemical Vapor Deposition using CH4, H2 and Ar. The doping process consisted of an additional hydrogen line, passing through a bubbler containing B2O3 dissolved in methanol, with boron/carbon ratio of 20000 ppm in solution. Raman spectroscopy and X-Ray diffraction were used to evaluate the quality of the films. Scanning electron microscopy was used for morphological characterization, and confirmed that the films covered the pores without filling them. Electrochemical response and capacitance behavior of the electrodes were explored, by cyclic voltammetry. Samples presented high capacitance, confirming that BDUND/PS electrodes are promising for application as electrochemical capacitors.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Morphological, structural and electrochemical characterization of PAni/BDND/CF ternary composite
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO-INGLES: Morphological, Structural and Electrochemical Characterization of PAni/BDND/CF Ternary Composite

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: International Conference on Diamond and Carbon Materials
DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.CIDADE-DA-APRESENTACAO: Bad Homburg vor der Hhe - Alemanha

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: SILVA, L. M.;DA SILVA, LILIAN MIEKO;SILVA, LILIAN MIEKO DA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The development of alternative sources for storage and energy conversion has been of great worldwide interest. Supercapacitors, also known as electrochemical capacitors, play an important role in energy storage systems, with significant advantages, including high power density, long lifecycle and operational safety. In this context, boron doped nanocrystalline diamond (BDND) films grown on carbon fibers (CF) has shown to be an excellent material for obtaining porous diamond electrodes with high surface area. In addition, conductive polymers, such as polyaniline (PAni), have also been used in energy devices, due to their great electrical properties and rapid electrochemical reversibility. Therefore, this work presents the production and characterization of PAni/BDND/CF ternary composite. BDND films were grown on CF, by Hot Filament CVD technique, using CH4, H2 and Ar. PAni synthesis was made in a NaCl/HCl solution with distilled aniline, during 60 min. Both the binary and ternary composites were morphological, structural and electrochemically characterized. FEG-SEM images showed that BDND and PAni coatings covered and enwrapped the fibers, forming a homogeneous film that may enhance the electrode surface area. Raman spectra confirmed the quality of the composites, presenting both BDND and PAni features. Cyclic voltammetry indicated that the ternary composite has a high current density with a capacitance response higher than that for the binary composite. They also presented more reversible oxidation and reduction processes as well as greater charge storage capacity and good electrochemical reversibility, observed from charge-discharge curves.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Filmes de nanodiamante dopados com boro, sobre substrato de silcio poroso anodizados sob diferentes condies de iluminao
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO-INGLES: BORON DOPED NANODIAMOND FILMS ON POROUS SILICON SUBSTRATES ANODIZED UNDER DIFFERENT ILLUMINATION CONDITIONS

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.INSTITUICAO-PROMOTORA: Associao Brasileira de Metalurgia, Materiais e Minerao

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: SILVA, L. M.;DA SILVA, LILIAN MIEKO;SILVA, LILIAN MIEKO DA

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-3.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: reas Clssicas de Fenomenologia e suas Aplicaes

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A utilizao de diamante sinttico vem crescendo nas ltimas dcadas, devido ao seu vasto conjunto de propriedades fsico-qumicas. A dopagem com boro permite obter diamante com menor resistividade, ideal para aplicaes eletroqumicas. O silcio poroso (PS) utilizado para crescimento de diamante por apresentar grande nmero de stios de nucleao e grande rea superficial, sendo excelente para obteno de eletrodos porosos. Neste trabalho, foram produzidas amostras de silcio poroso por anodizao, a partir de silcio monocristalino tipo-n, utilizando HF e acetonitrila como eletrlito. O sistema foi submetido a diferentes condies de iluminao, para avaliar sua influncia na morfologia dos poros. As amostras de PS foram utilizadas como substrato para crescimento de filmes de nanodiamante (NCD) atravs do processo CVD (Chemical Vapor Deposition), utilizando uma mistura de CH4, H2 e Ar. Microscopia eletrnica de varredura foi utilizada para caracterizar o substrato e a morfologia do filme. Concluiu-se que a iluminao afeta diretamente a morfologia dos poros, influenciando o crescimento do filme de diamante.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The use of synthetic diamond has increased in the last decades due to its wide range of physicochemical properties. The doping with boron allows obtaining diamond with lower resistivity, making it ideal for electrochemical applications. The porous silicon (PS) is used for diamond growth because of its large number of nucleation sites and large surface area, becoming an excellent material for porous electrodes. In this work, samples of porous silicon were produced by anodization of n-type monocrystalline silicon, using HF and acetonitrile as electrolyte. The system was submitted to different illumination conditions, to evaluate its influence on the pore morphologies. The PS samples were used as substrate to grow nanodiamond (NCD) film from CVD process (Chemical Vapor Deposition) using a mixture of CH4, H2 and Ar. Scanning electron microscopy was used to characterize the PS substrate, as well as the NCD film morphology. We concluded that the illumination process directly affects the pore morphology, influencing the diamond film growth.

INFORMACAO-ADICIONAL-CURSO.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Medidas Eltricas, Magnticas e Eletrnicas; Instrumentao
Eletrnica Industrial, Sistemas e Controles Eletrnicos
